title: Snow storm affects MLS clash between Minnesota and Atlanta as staff use LEAF BLOWERS to clear pitch

Josef Martinez smashed in a hat-trick for Atlanta United as they ran out 6-1 winners in a snow-affected MLS match away to Minnesota United. 
The match was played with an orange ball in sub-zero temperatures and the referee had to stop play several times for snow to be cleared from the touchlines with leaf blowers. 
It was the joint-coldest game in the history of the MLS with a kick-off temperature of 20 degrees Fahrenheit (-6 celsius). 
"The only positive that we can take from today is the people who braved the elements to come out," losing Minnesota coach Adrian Health said. 
"I thought their support was incredible, and it's just a pity that we couldn't give them any type of performance that warranted the support that we got." Tyrone Mears #2 of Atlanta United challenges Jermaine Taylor #4 of Minnesota United (Photo: Getty Images North America) A general view of the TCF Bank Stadium during the match (Photo: Getty Images North America) Tyrone Mears #2 of Atlanta United takes the ball away from Jermaine Taylor #4 of Minnesota United (Photo: Getty Images North America) Francisco Calvo #5 of Minnesota United slides into the net after a goal scored by Atlanta United's Josef Martinez (Photo: Getty Images North America) Jerome Thiesson #3 of Minnesota United passes the ball away from Chris McCann #16 of Atlanta United (Photo: Getty Images North America) Read More 'Arsene Wenger out' protest goes Stateside as fan frustration continues 4,000 miles away from the Emirates 
Atlanta were 3-0 up within 27 minutes courtesy of two goals from Martinez and a Miguel Almiron strike. 
Kevin Molino pulled one back for Minnesota from the penalty spot on the half-hour mark but further goals from Almiron, Martinez and Jacob Peterson after the interval sealed an emphatic win for the visitors. Atlanta goalscorer Molino said: "It's difficult circumstances, but it's part of the game. That is why the game is 90 percent mental." 
The Trinidad native, who had never before played a match in snow, added: "I found it a little difficult, but after a while I came to terms with it." Like us on Facebook
